summary_short: Introduces Father Fyodor Pavlovitch Zossima, Alexei Ivanovich Kalganov, Kolya Krasotkin and Katarina Ivanovna. Alyosha Karamazov is the most connected figure (22 ties). Key relationship types: other, opponent.
highlights: Most central: Alyosha Karamazov (22), Fyodor Karamazov (19), Dmitri Karamazov (17), Ivan Karamazov (16)
Key ties: Father–Mikhail (other), Father–Alexei (other), Dmitri–Father (opponent), Dmitri–Kolya (discontented acquaintance), +1 more
New characters: Father, Alexei, Kolya, Katarina
story_summary: Miüsov visits the Father Superior with Ivan and resolves to drop his litigation against the monastery, adopting a conciliatory attitude. Fyodor Pavlovitch unexpectedly returns to the monastery, disrupts the dinner with rude behavior, and declares his intention to take his son Alexey away from the monastery. After a tense departure, Fyodor Pavlovitch and Ivan travel home in silence, with Fyodor announcing plans to remove Alyosha from the monastery despite Ivan's contempt.
evidence_quotes: He determined to drop his litigation with the monastery
Fyodor Pavlovitch appeared in the Father Superior’s dining‐room
‘But I shall take Alyosha away from the monastery’
